msDesc.msIdentifier: UK Oxford Bodleian Library Ashmole Mss MS Ashmole 219, ff. 44v-45r &Forman004;

samplingDecl.p: Only the ‘question’ section of each consultation has been transcribed. This is the part of the entry that typically features the date and time of the consultation, the patient’s name, and an indication of the nature of the enquiry. Often, it also includes further details such as the querent’s identity if he or she is not the same person as the patient, the patient’s age, address, occupation and relation to the querent or any third parties mentioned. In the vast majority of cases, this information is contained within the first paragraph of the record although it is not uncommon, especially in Napier’s entries, for this information to be scattered throughout the entry.

revisionDesc.change: Data entered in Microsoft Excel spreadsheet by Robert Ralley as part of the Casebooks Pilot Project.

text.body:
Robarte &ff;ranck of 
29 yers in flet stret at the 
Turk&pluralLoop; hed fakenam. which 
trad or way is best for him 
to tak or &vVowel;se to Ly&uConsonant;e 1599 
the 18 Aprill &Wednesday; &anflmfl; at 20 
&past; 9 ipeipse fecit hanc questo

&astroChart;






&crossedp;pro eodem Roberto 
franco. &vVowel;t supra

&geoChart;
